taint.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if a situation or person is tainted by something, it damages them by making them seem bad
taint.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Baker argues that his trial was tainted by negative publicity.
taint.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to damage something by adding an unwanted substance to it
taint.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The water had been tainted with a deadly toxin.
taint.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the appearance of being related to something bad or morally wrong
taint.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The city has suffered for many years under the taint of corruption.
